<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9709/32  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 309, 316]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 358, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 212, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 384, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 728, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 781, 96]]<|/det|>
Find the quotient and remainder when \(x^{4} - 3x^{3} + 9x^{2} - 12x + 27\) is divided by \(x^{2} + 5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 94]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 336, 92]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(z = -\sqrt{3} + \mathrm{i}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 104, 144, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 103, 626, 123]]<|/det|>
Express \(z^{2}\) in the form \(r\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\theta}\), where \(r > 0\) and \(-\pi < \theta \leqslant \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 504, 191, 523]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 501, 645, 526]]<|/det|>
The complex number \(\omega\) is such that \(z^{2}\omega\) is real and \(\left|\frac{z^{2}}{\omega}\right| = 12\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 536, 920, 572]]<|/det|>
Find the two possible values of \(\omega\), giving your answers in the form \(R\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\alpha}\), where \(R > 0\) and \(-\pi < \alpha \leqslant \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 554, 920, 573]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 455, 89]]<|/det|>
The positive numbers \(p\) and \(q\) are such that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[379, 102, 620, 136]]<|/det|>
\[\ln \left(\frac{p}{q}\right) = a\quad \mathrm{and}\quad \ln \left(q^{2}p\right) = b.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 152, 405, 172]]<|/det|>
Express \(\ln \left(p^{7}q\right)\) in terms of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 153, 920, 171]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
On a sketch of an Argand diagram, shade the region whose points represent complex numbers \(z\) satisfying the inequalities \(\left|z - 4 - 2\mathrm{i}\right| \leqslant 3\) and \(\left|z\right| \geqslant \left|10 - z\right|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 85, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 520, 146, 539]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 520, 591, 540]]<|/det|>
Find the greatest value of \(\arg z\) for points in this region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 520, 920, 539]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 94, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 475, 95]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(2y^{2} + 3xy + x = x^{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 109, 144, 129]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 104, 381, 133]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \frac{2x - 3y - 1}{4y + 3x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 112, 920, 131]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 771, 88]]<|/det|>
Hence show that the curve does **not** have a tangent that is parallel to the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 88]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 574, 91]]<|/det|>
Verify by calculation that \(\alpha\) lies between 0.4 and 0.5 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 91]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 380, 186, 400]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 380, 920, 415]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula based on the equation in part **(a)** to determine \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 399, 920, 415]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 79, 99, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 79, 144, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 76, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
Express \(3 \sin x + 2 \sqrt{2} \cos \left(x + \frac{1}{4} \pi\right)\) in the form \(R \sin (x + \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0 < \alpha < \frac{1}{2} \pi\). State the exact value of \(R\) and give \(\alpha\) correct to 3 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 102, 917, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 757, 91]]<|/det|>
Relative to the origin \(O\), the position vectors of the points \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\) are given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 100, 755, 121]]<|/det|>
\[\overrightarrow{OA} = 5\mathbf{i} - 2\mathbf{j} + \mathbf{k},\quad \overrightarrow{OB} = 8\mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j} - 6\mathbf{k}\quad \mathrm{and}\quad \overrightarrow{OC} = 3\mathbf{i} + 4\mathbf{j} - 7\mathbf{k}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 133, 144, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 405, 152]]<|/det|>
Show that \(OABC\) is a rectangle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 752, 88]]<|/det|>
Use a scalar product to find the acute angle between the diagonals of \(OABC\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 918, 88]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 79, 146, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
Hence find the exact value of \(\int_{-a}^{a} \mathrm{f}(x) \mathrm{d}x\), giving your answer in the form \(p \ln q + r \ln s\) where \(p\) and \(r\) are integers and \(q\) and \(s\) are prime numbers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 104, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 534, 92]]<|/det|>
The variables \(y\) and \(\theta\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[386, 98, 609, 128]]<|/det|>
\[(1 + y)(1 + \cos 2\theta)\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}\theta} = \mathrm{e}^{3y}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 133, 400, 153]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(y = 0\) when \(\theta = \frac{1}{4}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 164, 715, 183]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation and find the exact value of \(\tan \theta\) when \(y = 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 165, 920, 183]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 72, 567, 89]]<|/det|>
# Additional page  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
